statement.tex: \text{The volume of a cube is increasing at the}\\ \text{rate of }8\frac{cm^3}{s}.\text{How fast is its surface}\\ \text{area increasing when the length of an}\\ \text{edge is 12 cm?}

step.context: \text{Given the surface area (A) and length of}\\ \text{a side (L) at time T, what do we have to find?}
step.reason: \text{We have to find }\frac{dA}{dT}\text{ when }L=12\text{ cm.}\\ \text{In other words, }\left[\frac{dA}{dT}\right]_{L=12}.
\text{Again, we were given the rate at which the volume}\\ \text{was increasing, that is, }\frac{dV}{dT}.\text{And from this, we infer}\frac{dL}{dT}.
\text{You know }\frac{dL}{dT}\text{ from Step #2. And you}\\ \text{need }\frac{dA}{dT}.\text{The missing piece is }\frac{dA}{dL}.
